duties_responsibilities.duty: Establish and maintain professional relationships with suppliers, acting as the main point of contact for all supplier component quality correspondence.
Monitor and manage supplier quality performance (PPM) and partner with suppliers regarding corrective actions.

Identify and address problem areas within supplier quality, initiating requests to investigate quality issues and developing and maintaining PPAP and supplier Corrective Actions Tracking Systems (CATS).
Collaborate with other departments to evaluate potential supplier quality concerns and document supplier quality processes.
Ensure suppliers understand basic expectations such as 24-hour response, containment, and financial responsibility for supplier-related quality issues.
Administer internal supplier containment and maintain the return material cage, as well as oversee supplier chargeback activity.
Assist with reviewing and approving supplier PPAP packages, as well as external supplier containment. Provide leadership, direction, and coaching to the Supplier Quality Technicians.
Curate supplier PPM data for KPI tracking and provide the accompanying corrective actions, maintaining awareness of the activities performed by the supplier quality engineering team.
